snippet: Judge Mark Horner said that ordering changes to allow terminations in the case of a fatal fetal abnormality, rape or incest would be “a step too far.”
abstract: Judge Mark Horner of Northern Ireland High Court declines to change strict abortion laws; ruling places responsibility to resolve matter with local assembly.
lead_paragraph: Judge Mark Horner said that ordering changes to allow terminations in the case of a fatal fetal abnormality, rape or incest would be “a step too far.”

headline.main: Judge Leaves Northern Ireland’s Abortion Laws to Lawmakers
headline.print_headline: World Briefing | Europe; Northern Ireland: Abortion Ban Stands

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Human Rights and Human Rights Violations
